children.value: % All begin commands must be paired with an end command somewhere
% creates title using information in preamble (title, author, date)
%notice how the command will end at the first non-alphabet charecter such as the . after \LaTeX
is a great program for writing math. I can write in line math such as

value: [Equality(Symbol('b'), Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Add(Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2)))), Equality(Symbol('b'), Pow(Add(Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2))), Equality(Symbol('c'), Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Add(Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2)), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2)))), Equality(Symbol('c'), Pow(Add(Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2)), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2))), Equality(Symbol('a'), Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Add(Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2)))), Equality(Symbol('a'), Pow(Add(Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2)))]

children.value: %$ tells LaTexX to compile as math
. I can also give equations their own space:
% Creates an equation environment and is compiled as math
If I do not leave any blank lines

will continue  this text without making it into a new paragraph.  Notice how there was no indentation in the text after equation (1).  
    Also notice how even though I

[Equality(Symbol('b'), Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Add(Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2)))), Equality(Symbol('b'), Pow(Add(Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2))), Equality(Symbol('c'), Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Add(Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2)), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2)))), Equality(Symbol('c'), Pow(Add(Pow(Symbol('a'), Integer(2)), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2))), Equality(Symbol('a'), Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Add(Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2)))), Equality(Symbol('a'), Pow(Add(Mul(Integer(-1), Pow(Symbol('b'), Integer(2))), Pow(Symbol('c'), Integer(2))), Rational(1, 2)))]
hit enter after that sentence and here

formats the sentence without any break.  Also   look  how      it   doesn't     matter          how    many  spaces     I put     between       my    words.
    
    For a new paragraph I can leave a blank space in my code.
